item.title: Creating WaveForm while speaking
item.dc:creator: guysch
item.description:
Hey,

First of all I would like to thank you for this awesome library!

I would like to add some graphic representation of the user voice (just like siri on ios 7).. I found some examples that can help me draw the wave form, my problem is how can I access the microphone data (I haven’t found any delegate method that can pass the voice data so I can parse it into a wave form)

am I missing something?

Thanks in advance and keep up the good work :)

Guy.

item.title: Reply To: Creating WaveForm while speaking
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Welcome,

Sure, just check out the sample app which ships with the main distribution in order to see examples of OpenEars level reading methods with comments on their use.

item.title: Reply To: Creating WaveForm while speaking
item.dc:creator: guysch
item.description: Great that exactly what I was looking for, thanks again (:

item.title: Reply To: Creating WaveForm while speaking
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
